column4: Hi... can anyone suggest a good guide to using wpa_supplicant (network manager is broken for my card since 7.10 and wicd has other issues)?
I'm using iwl3945 and have WPA issues under Ubuntu...
I think its this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/272185 ... but it seems to have ceased updating
Hi... can anyone suggest a good guide to using wpa_supplicant (network manager is broken for my iwl3945 card since 7.10 and wicd has other issues)?
that's strange. That card should work great on Ubuntu. Which version do you have installed?
- Works fine on WEP, WPA/2, but not the enterprise version... lots of disconnects. Theres a huge (>200 posts) bug report about it, but its stopped updating. Its an Intel 3945ABG.
oh, I see... Well, if there's that huge bug report, then it means that it's probably messed up... Did you already comment on it?

- Seems to be a networkmanger + iwl3945 issue... works fine in wicd (except wicd has its own different problems) and other users on the same network but different cards have no issues with network manager... the bug report is quite old and has no recent updates :(
- Last version that worked was 7.10. Since then its been broken in all versions.
are you on a home network?
- Works fine on my home WPA2 Personal network (network manager or wicd)... any WPA enterprise network however doesnt

I see... The only thing I can suggest is to either use WiCD or use the development version of Ubuntu's Network manager that you can find in this PPA: https://launchpad.net/~network-manager/+archive/ppa
- Using wicd now but seems to have memory/CPU issues... tried the latest network manager build a while ago with no luck, will try again when i can. Thanks :)
OK, good luck and sorry for not being much of help
- Thanks anyway :) Its the bugs that make Ubuntu interesting :D
